dataset.title: Arctic LTER 2001: Soil temperature data from the Toolik Moist Non-acidic Tussock Experimental plots (MNT).

abstract.para: Soil temperature data from the Toolik Moist Non-acidic Tussock Experimental plots (MNT). In 1999 a Campbell CR10x data logger was installed in block 2 of the experimental plots. The plots are located on a hillside near Toolik Lake (68 38' N, 149 36'W). Sensors were placed in control, fertilized, greenhouse and greenhouse fertilized sites.

intellectualRights.para: Acceptance and utilization of LTER data requires that:

listitem.para: The Principal Investigator be sent a notice stating reasons for acquiring any data and a description of the publication intentions.
The Principal Investigator of the data set be sent a copy of the report or manuscript prior to submission and be adequately cited in any resultant publications

A copy of any resultant publications should be sent to:
Principal Investigator Ecosystems Center Marine Biological Laboratory Woods Hole, MA 02543

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Toolik Lake Field Station (68 38' N, 149 36'W), LTER Moist Non-acidic tussock site on hill south of Toolik Lake, North Slope of Alaska.

description.para:
For Archival Use:
DATE RECEIVED: 3May2001Aug2001 DATA FILE ENTERED BY: J.Laundre DATA FILE VALIDATION: 3May2002 NAME: JL DATE:

para.literalLayout: A Campbell CR10x data logger, in the LTER Toolik Moist Non-acidic Tussock Experimental plots (block 2), is used to monitor weather and soil temperatures. Sensors in the control and greenhouses plots include: air temperature and relative humidity. These sensors are read every minute and averaged or totaled every hour. Two profiles of soil temperature are measured per treatment plot with copper/constantan thermocouple wires (TC) installed at depths of 0,10, 20, and 40 cm in inter-tussock areas. The following label codes are used: CT = control, GH = greenhouses, NP = fertilized, GHF= greenhouse fertilized, plus a 1 or a 2 for the profile number. All soil sensors are read every 15 minutes and averaged every 3 hours. Hourly, three hourly and daily summaries are in files yyDLMNTH.DAT, yyDLMNTO.DAT, and yDLMNTD.DAT respectively, where yy is the year in which the data are collected. The original data are in file yyDLMNTDAT.ZIP which is archived at The Marine Biological Lab, Woods Hole, MA. Note: The covers on greenhouses are removed every fall and reinstalled every spring.
Notes: Missing values are indicated by #N/A. Greenhouse air temperature and RH sensor was not added until Jun15,2000

Variable Variable description. Precision/Units YEAR Year YYYY DATE Date DD-MMM-YYYY MONTH Month DAYS Julian plus fraction of day ID Program step that output the data JULIAN Julian Date ddd 3meter Celsius CT Air MAX Maximum temperature at 3 meter Celsius HOUR of CT Air MAX Time of air temperature max at 3 meters HHMM GH Air MAX Maximum temperature in greenhouse Celsius Hour of GH Air MAX Time of greenhouse air temperature max HHMM MIN CT TEMP 3M Minimum air temperature at 3 meter Celsius HOUR of CT Air MIN Time of air temperature min at 3 meter HHMM GH Air MIN Minimum temperature in greenhouse Celsius Hour of GH Air MIN Time of greenhouse air temperature min HHMM CT Air 3m Daily average air temperature at 3 meters Celsius GH Air Daily greenhouse air temperature Celsius COMMENTS Comments about individual datum points. (12) CALCULATIONS Variable Formula
